elements.title: Towards accurate differential diagnosis with large language models (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Towards accurate differential diagnosis with large language models

Diagnostic reasoning using an optimized large language model with a dataset comprising real-world medical cases exhibited improved differential diagnostic performance as an assistive tool for clinicians over search engines and standard medical resources.

  • Daniel McDuff
  • Mike Schaekermann
  • Vivek Natarajan
ArticleOpen Access09 Apr 2025

elements.title: Connectomics of predicted Sst transcriptomic types in mouse visual cortex (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Connectomics of predicted Sst transcriptomic types in mouse visual cortex

The authors use Patch-seq and electron microscopy datasets to relate synaptic connectivity to the transcriptomic cell type of different types of inhibitory neuron.

  • Clare R. Gamlin
  • Casey M. Schneider-Mizell
  • Staci A. Sorensen
ArticleOpen Access09 Apr 2025

elements.title: Ultra-broadband optical amplification using nonlinear integrated waveguides (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Ultra-broadband optical amplification using nonlinear integrated waveguides

An integrated optical parametric amplifier with an ultra-wide bandwidth was implemented using geometrically optimized low-loss nonlinear rib silicon nitride waveguides including the demonstration of broadband all-optical wavelength conversion.

  • Ping Zhao
  • Vijay Shekhawat
  • Peter A. Andrekson
ArticleOpen Access09 Apr 2025

elements.title: Immune checkpoint TIM-3 regulates microglia and Alzheimer’s disease (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Immune checkpoint TIM-3 regulates microglia and Alzheimer’s disease

The immune-checkpoint molecule TIM-3 regulates microglial homeostasis, and its microglial-specific deletion reduced cognitive impairment in a mouse model of Alzheimer’s disease.

  • Kimitoshi Kimura
  • Ayshwarya Subramanian
  • Vijay K. Kuchroo
Article09 Apr 2025

elements.title: Active energy compression of a laser-plasma electron beam (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Active energy compression of a laser-plasma electron beam

A laser-plasma electron beam generated using active energy compression demonstrates reduction in energy spread and jitter by an order of magnitude to below the permille level, comparable with modern radio-frequency accelerators.

  • P. Winkler
  • M. Trunk
  • A. R. Maier
ArticleOpen Access09 Apr 2025

elements.title: Swinging lever mechanism of myosin directly shown by time-resolved cryo-EM (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Swinging lever mechanism of myosin directly shown by time-resolved cryo-EM

A study using time-resolved cryogenic electron microscopy reveals the swinging lever mechanism of myosin, providing information on the molecular basis behind the production of force and movement by myosin.

  • David P. Klebl
  • Sean N. McMillan
  • Howard D. White
ArticleOpen Access09 Apr 2025

elements.title: Foundation model of neural activity predicts response to new stimulus types (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Foundation model of neural activity predicts response to new stimulus types

A foundation model trained on neural activity of visual cortex from multiple mice accurately predicts responses to video stimuli and cell types, dendritic features and connectivity within the MICrONS functional connectomics dataset.

  • Eric Y. Wang
  • Paul G. Fahey
  • Andreas S. Tolias
ArticleOpen Access09 Apr 2025

elements.title: Leaf absorption contributes to accumulation of microplastics in plants (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Leaf absorption contributes to accumulation of microplastics in plants

Absorption and accumulation of atmospheric microplastics by plant leaves occurs widely in the environment.

  • Ye Li
  • Junjie Zhang
  • Lei Wang
Article09 Apr 2025

elements.title: Phenotypic complexities of rare heterozygous neurexin-1 deletions (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Phenotypic complexities of rare heterozygous neurexin-1 deletions

How NRXN1 variants affect multiple neuropsychiatric disorders is explored.

  • Michael B. Fernando
  • Yu Fan
  • Kristen J. Brennand
Article09 Apr 2025

elements.title: Human assembloid model of the ascending neural sensory pathway (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Human assembloid model of the ascending neural sensory pathway

A human ascending somatosensory assembloid model was developed, which integrates multiple organoids to simulate the spinothalamic pathway, demonstrating functional connectivity and responsiveness to stimuli and revealing insights into pain-related genetic mutations.

  • Ji-il Kim
  • Kent Imaizumi
  • Sergiu P. Pașca
ArticleOpen Access09 Apr 2025

elements.title: Perisomatic ultrastructure efficiently classifies cells in mouse cortex (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Perisomatic ultrastructure efficiently classifies cells in mouse cortex

An analysis demonstrates that quantitative measurements of perisomatic ultrastructure features of neurons can be used to categorize them into cell types.

  • Leila Elabbady
  • Sharmishtaa Seshamani
  • Forrest Collman
ArticleOpen Access09 Apr 2025

elements.title: Comprehensive interrogation of synthetic lethality in the DNA damage response (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Comprehensive interrogation of synthetic lethality in the DNA damage response

Combinatorial CRISPRi screening was used to map genetic interactions in DNA damage response pathways, revealing known and new connections, including the roles of WDR48 and USP1 in preventing under-replication and SMARCAL1 and FANCM in remodelling persistent cruciform DNA structures.

  • John Fielden
  • Sebastian M. Siegner
  • Jacob E. Corn
ArticleOpen Access09 Apr 2025

elements.title: Seismic imaging of a basaltic Lesser Antilles slab from ancient tectonics (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Seismic imaging of a basaltic Lesser Antilles slab from ancient tectonics

Imaging of the mantle transition zone beneath the Lesser Antilles shows a basalt-rich region within the subducting slab near the proposed location of a subducted extinct spreading ridge, implying ancient tectonics play a role in influencing slab trajectories.

  • Xusong Yang
  • Yujiang Xie
  • Richard Robertson
ArticleOpen Access09 Apr 2025

elements.title: Giant electrocaloric effect in high-polar-entropy perovskite oxides (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Giant electrocaloric effect in high-polar-entropy perovskite oxides

Targeted multielement substitution of a lead-free relaxor ferroelectric perovskite distorts the lattice structure and induces strong polar disorder, leading to high-polar-entropy ferroelectric oxides with a high electrocaloric effect and long lifetime.

  • Feihong Du
  • Tiannan Yang
  • Xiaoshi Qian
Article09 Apr 2025

elements.title: A non-contact wearable device for monitoring epidermal molecular flux (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
A non-contact wearable device for monitoring epidermal molecular flux

A non-contact wearable device that defines and modulates a microclimate adjacent to the skin can measure incoming and outgoing streams of vapourized substances, offering valuable insights into physiological health, wound healing and environmental exposures.

  • Jaeho Shin
  • Joseph Woojin Song
  • John A. Rogers
Article09 Apr 2025

elements.title: Reprogramming site-specific retrotransposon activity to new DNA sites (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Reprogramming site-specific retrotransposon activity to new DNA sites

A study of retrotransposon activity repurposes a retroelement called R2Tocc to create a programmable system called STITCHR that enables diverse genome edits including efficient, scarless large payload insertions.

  • Christopher W. Fell
  • Lukas Villiger
  • Jonathan S. Gootenberg
Article09 Apr 2025

elements.title: Hunter-gatherer sea voyages extended to remotest Mediterranean islands (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Hunter-gatherer sea voyages extended to remotest Mediterranean islands

Archaeological discoveries from Malta suggest that humans were present on the Maltese islands from around 8,500 years ago, providing evidence that Mesolithic hunter-gatherers made sea crossings as long as 100 km.

  • Eleanor M. L. Scerri
  • James Blinkhorn
  • Nicholas C. Vella
ArticleOpen Access09 Apr 2025

elements.title: NEURD offers automated proofreading and feature extraction for connectomics (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
NEURD offers automated proofreading and feature extraction for connectomics

Neural Decomposition (NEURD) is a software package that decomposes neuronal data from high-resolution electron microscopy volumes into feature-rich graph representations to facilitate analysis for neuroscience research.

  • Brendan Celii
  • Stelios Papadopoulos
  • Jacob Reimer
ArticleOpen Access09 Apr 2025

elements.title: Complete sequencing of ape genomes (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Complete sequencing of ape genomes

Complete sequences of chromosomes telomere-to-telomere from chimpanzee, bonobo, gorilla, Bornean orangutan, Sumatran orangutan and siamang provide a comprehensive and valuable resource for future evolutionary comparisons.

  • DongAhn Yoo
  • Arang Rhie
  • Evan E. Eichler
ArticleOpen Access09 Apr 2025
